logic.workstation

Class Workstation

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.workstation.Workstation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessoriesPost, CarBodyPost, DriveTrainPost

    public abstract class Workstation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to describe a work station of an assembly line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Workstation()
      Constructs a workstation and initializes the current order to null.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean done()
      Checks whether all tasks, of the current order which can be performed on this workstation, have been completed.
      void doTask(Task task)
      Executes a given task if the task is compatible with this workstation.
      abstract java.util.List<CarPartType> getCapabilities()
      Get the types of tasks that can be performed on this workstation.
      CarOrder getCurrentOrder()
      Returns the order currently being serviced by this workstation.
      java.util.List<Task> getRequiredTasks()
      Returns the list of tasks from the current order that can be performed on this workstation.
      boolean idle()
      Returns whether or not this workstation has been assigned a car order to work on.
      boolean isCompatibleTask(Task task)
      Checks whether the given task can be performed on this workstation.
      void setOrder(CarOrder order)
      Sets the given order as the current order.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Workstation

        public Workstation()
        Constructs a workstation and initializes the current order to null. If the current order is null the workstation represents an idle workstation.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentOrder

        public CarOrder getCurrentOrder()
        Returns the order currently being serviced by this workstation. When the current order is null, the workstation is idle.
        Returns:
        The current order.

      • idle

        public boolean idle()
        Returns whether or not this workstation has been assigned a car order to work on.
        Returns:
        True if the current order is null. False otherwise.

      • done

        public boolean done()
        Checks whether all tasks, of the current order which can be performed on this workstation, have been completed.
        Returns:
        True if and only if there isn't a task left that this workspace can complete for the current order. False otherwise.

      • setOrder

        public void setOrder(CarOrder order)
        Sets the given order as the current order. The task list will be cleared and updated with the compatible task(s) of the new order.
        Parameters:
        order - Any car order. Can be completed, semi-completed, or not started.

      • isCompatibleTask

        public boolean isCompatibleTask(Task task)
        Checks whether the given task can be performed on this workstation.
        Parameters:
        task - The task that needs to be checked for compatibility.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the task can be performed on this workstation, the task is not null and the task is not already completed. False otherwise.

      • getCapabilities

        public abstract java.util.List<CarPartType> getCapabilities()
        Get the types of tasks that can be performed on this workstation. This method completely defines the capabilities of an implementing class.
        Returns:
        A List of CarPartType elements defining the capabilities of the implementation.

      • doTask

        public void doTask(Task task)
        Executes a given task if the task is compatible with this workstation.
        Parameters:
        task - The task which requires completion.

      • getRequiredTasks

        public java.util.List<Task> getRequiredTasks()
        Returns the list of tasks from the current order that can be performed on this workstation.
        Returns:
        The list of tasks from the current order that can be performed on this workstation.
